title: These former NHL-ers are used to fighting each other, but now they're dancing to a new tune | CBC Television
text: It seems like almost a lifetime ago that Brian McGrattan and Colton Orr laced up their hockey skates and got on the ice together. The two former NHL-ers were notorious for their on-ice boxing matches that left them both battered and bloody (for the most part) on multiple occasions. (Source: Andy Marlin/Getty Images) On Sept. 19, the two will reunite on ice, but this time they're taking a shot at figure skating. They will be competing with their figure skating counterparts on this season's Battle of The Blades to win $100,000 for charities close to their hearts: McGrattan will skate for the Alberta Animal Rescue Crew Society and Orr for Smile Zone. On Sept. 19, the two will reunite on ice, but this time they're taking a shot at figure skating. They will be competing with their figure skating counterparts on this season's Battle of The Blades to win $100,000 for charities close to their hearts: McGrattan will skate for the Alberta Animal Rescue Crew Society and Orr for Smile Zone. It's heartwarming — if a bit jarring — to see these former tough guys morph into teddy bears. "I never thought when I was fighting this guy in my career that I'd be holding hands with him out there spinning on the ice," laughs McGrattan. Orr says this gives an all-new meaning to the classic phrase "You wanna dance?" Fans can't wait to see some of their favourite former hockey players teamed up with incredible figure skaters to compete in a whole new way. McGrattan is paired with Vanessa James and Orr with Amanda Evora. BOTB [is] bringing people together in more ways than one. Too funny! - Anna Echols on Facebook This gives a new meaning to you wanna Dance! 👊🏻 https://t.co/27z1cRiNeC —@EnforceOrr With Battle of The Blades, you just have to expect the unexpected. We'll have to wait and see if the two are able to channel their pugilist pasts into graceful spins and lifts as they fight to win the top skating pair. Battle of the Blades will launch with a special two-hour premiere on Thursday, September 19 at 8 p.m. (8:30 NT) on CBC and the free CBC Gem streaming service, with new episodes Thursdays at 8 p.m. (9 AT, 9:30 NT).
description: Colton Orr and Brian McGrattan fought each other in the NHL. Now they’re dancing on ice and competing for charity.
